meanings.sent1: She managed to outstep her classmates in the dance competition.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trained hard to outstep his previous record in the race.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse tried to outstep the cat in a playful game of chase.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outstep all obstacles led her to success.
meanings.sent5: The sun outstepped the clouds, shining brightly in the sky.

meanings.sent1: The hiker decided to outstep the marked trail and explore the unknown forest.
meanings.sent2: The adventurous explorer always seeks to outstep the boundaries of the known world.
meanings.sent3: The curious puppy tried to outstep its usual route and ended up lost in the park.
meanings.sent4: His ambition to outstep his limitations pushed him to achieve great things.
meanings.sent5: The river outstepped its banks, flooding the nearby fields.

meanings.sent1: The dancer's graceful movements seemed to outstep the boundaries of human capability.
meanings.sent2: The artist's creativity knew no bounds as he outstepped traditional techniques.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to outstep the rules by sneaking out past bedtime.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams always outstep the confines of reality, taking her to magical worlds.
meanings.sent5: The wind outstepped the trees, carrying their whispers far and wide.
